lead_paragraph: The American economy added 151,000 jobs last month, a performance that could support the position of those within the Fed who favor delaying an interest-rate increase.

byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport contributed to this article.

headline.print_headline: Slower Jobs Growth May Give Fed Pause on Rates
headline.main: Slower Growth in Jobs Report May Give Fed Pause on Interest Rates

snippet: The American economy added 151,000 jobs last month, a performance that could support the position of those within the Fed who favor delaying an interest-rate increase....
abstract: Labor Dept reports data for August shows 151,000 jobs were added, unemployment remained at 4.9 percent and wage gains were modest; economists interpret results as sign economy is doing well but not overheating and interest rate hike unnecessary.
